etymology.description: pictogram: a standing person; radical form of 人; also simplified from 兒 by eliminating 臼
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a person standing on two legs, which is why it doubles as the person radical form. In traditional 兒, an added 臼 element evoked a baby’s soft skull, but simplification removed that part, leaving only the person/legs shape.
etymology.simplification: Stroke reduction by dropping 臼 from 兒 and reusing the existing person-radical form 儿.

examples.chinese: 我儿子在学校(我兒子在學校)。
她是我的女儿(她是我的女兒)。
这些电影很适合儿童观看(這些電影很適合兒童觀看)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèxiē diànyǐng hěn shìhé értóng guānkàn.
examples.english: These movies are very suitable for children to watch.
